URL: http://plants.usda.gov/ [Accessed 2010-04-01].";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:88:"Considered NHP under Schedule 1 item 1, plant or plant material, of the NHP Regulations.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:127:"Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1 (plante ou matière végétale) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:0:"";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"85441";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:21:"Pseudotsuga menziesii";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"AHN";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:5:"PLANT";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";s:5:"title";s:25:"Pseudotsuga menziesii_AHN";s:3:"nid";s:6:"197523";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:197524;a:25:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:5:"94564";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:1442:"Proper Name(s): Pterospermum heterophyllum (USDA 2010)
Common Name(s): Heterophyllous winged-seed (HK Herbarium 2010)

Pterospermum heterophyllum is a plant from the family Malvaceae, native to China (USDA 2010). Many triterpenoids were found in the roots of Pterospermum heterophyllum and at least one of them showed cytotoxicity against several human cancer cells (Li et al. 2009).

Based on the above, Pterospermum heterophyllum meets the substance aspect of the Natural Health Product (NHP) definition, under Schedule 1, item 1 (plant) of the NHP Regulations (Government of Canada 2010).

References:

Government of Canada 2010. Natural Health Products Regulations. URL: http://laws.justice.gc.ca/en/showtdm/cr/SOR-2003-196//?showtoc=&instrumentnumber=SOR-2003-196 [Accessed 2010-03-24].

USDA 2010. ARS, National Genetic Resources Program. Germplasm Resources Information Network - (GRIN) [Online Database]. National Germplasm Resources Laboratory, Beltsville, Maryland. URL: http://www.ars-grin.gov/cgi-bin/npgs/html/index.pl?language=en [Accessed 2010-03-24].";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:88:"Considered NHP under Schedule 1 item 1, plant or plant material, of the NHP Regulations.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:127:"Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1 (plante ou matière végétale) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:0:"";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"85442";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:26:"Pterospermum heterophyllum";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"AHN";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:5:"PLANT";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";s:5:"title";s:30:"Pterospermum heterophyllum_AHN";s:3:"nid";s:6:"197524";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:197525;a:25:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:5:"94567";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:2396:"Proper Name(s): Vincetoxicum stauntonii, Cynanchum stauntonii (USDA 2010)
Common Name(s): Willowleaf swallowwort (Wu 2005)

Cynanchum stauntonii, a synonym for Vincetoxicum stauntonii, is a plant from the family Apocynaceae, native to China (GBIF 2010, NIH 2010, USDA 2010). It has been used as antitussive and expectorant in traditional Chinese medicine, and known to contain various chemical constituents, such as stigmasterol, ursolic acid, steroidal glycosides, β-sitosterol, hancockinol, and stauntonine (Fu et al. 2007, Wu 2005, Wang et al. 2004). The volatile oil of the roots of Cynanchum stauntonii exhibited activity against the influenza virus, in vitro as well as in vivo (Zai-Chang et al. 2005).

Based on the above, Cynanchum stauntonii meets the substance aspect of the Natural Health Product (NHP) definition, under Schedule 1, item 1 (plant) of the NHP Regulations (Government of Canada 2010).

References:

Common Name(s): Greater galangal (ITIS 2010, USDA 2010)

Alpinia galanga, commonly known as Greater galangal, is a plant from the family Zingiberaceae (ITIS 2010, USDA 2010). This plant, mainly as its rhizome extract, has shown, experimentally, a variety of biological activities, such as anti-ulcerative, hypoglycaemic, gastroprotective, antiallergic, antibacterial, antifungal, immunostimulating, anti-nitric oxide production, anti-HIV, anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and antitumor; most of these properties have been attributed to its content in 1’S-1’-acetoxychavicol acetate and related phenylpropanoids (Panich et al. 2010, Rao et al. 2010, Tamura et al. 2010, Latha et al. 2009, Phitak et al. 2009, Tamura et al. 2009, Yasuhara et al. 2009, Trakranrungsie et al. 2008, Ye and Li 2006, Khattak et al. 2005, Morikawa et al. 2005, Bendjeddou et al. 2003, Matsuda et al. 2003a, Matsuda et al. 2003b, Akhtar et al. 2002, Someya et al. 2001, Kubota et al. 1999, Mitsui et al. 1976).

Based on the above, Alpinia galanga meets the substance aspect of the Natural Health Product (NHP) definition, under Schedule 1, item 1 (plant) of the NHP Regulations (Government of Canada 2010).

Common Name(s): Halut bidar (USDA 2010)

Tribulus alatus, a synonym for Tribulus pentandrus, is a plant from the family Zygophyllaceae (USDA 2010). The aerial parts methanolic extract of this plant has shown, experimentally in rats, aphrodisiac activity, attributed, at least in part, to its content in steroidal saponins (El-Tantawy et al. 2007, Temraz et al. 2006).

Based on the above, Tribulus pentandrus meets the substance aspect of the Natural Health Product (NHP) definition, under Schedule 1, item 1 (Plant) of the NHP Regulations (Government of Canada 2010).

References:

El-Tantawy W.H., Temraz A., El-Gindi O.D. 2007. Free Serum Testosterone Level in Male Rats Treated with Tribulus alatus Extracts. International Braz. J. Urol. 33(4): 554-559.

Common Name(s): Chinese white-olive (NIH 2010, USDA 2010)

Canarium album, commonly known as Chinese white-olive, is a plant from the family Burseraceae (NIH 2010, USDA 2010). Extracts of this plant have shown, experimentally, to possess hepatoprotective activity, due, at least in part, to their content in antioxidant compounds, such as bevifolin, hyperin, and ellagic acid (Zhang and Lin 2008, Ito et al. 1990).

Based on the above, Canarium album meets the substance aspect of the Natural Health Product (NHP) definition, under Schedule 1, item 1 (plant) of the NHP Regulations (Government of Canada 2010).

Common Name(s): Chinese hibiscus, Rose-of-China, Shoebackplant (ITIS 2010, NIH 2010, USDA 2010)
Hibiscus rosa-sinensis is a plant from the family Malvaceae, having ornamental and folklore medicine economic importance (ITIS 2010, NIH 2010, USDA 2010). Different extracts of this plant have shown, experimentally, to possess various biological activities, such as hair-growth promoting, antifertility, hypocholesterolemic, hypoglycemic, hypotriglyceridemic, antioxidant, cardioprotective, and antiproliferative (Vasudeva and Sharma 2008, Gauthaman et al. 2006, Nivsarkar et al. 2005, Sharma et al. 2004, Sharma and Sultana 2004, Adhirajan et al. 2003, Sachdewa and Khemani 2003, Murthy et al. 1997, Shimizu et al. 1993, Prakash et al. 1990).

sur les produits de santé naturels";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:0:"";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"85451";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:15:"Aralia racemosa";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"AHN";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:5:"PLANT";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";s:5:"title";s:19:"Aralia racemosa_AHN";s:3:"nid";s:6:"197532";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:197533;a:25:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:11:"94922;94423";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:1077:"Schizochytrium is a genus of microalgae (Class: Phycomycota, algae-like fungi) from the family Thraustochytriaceae (ITIS 2010, GBIF 2010). Schizochytrium  and its oil are rich sources of omega-3 fatty acids, notably DHA (Doughman et al. 2007).
Based on the above, Schizochytrium and its oil meet the substance aspect of the Natural Health Product (NHP) definition, under Schedule 1, item 1 (alga) or 2 (extract), of the NHP Regulations (Government of Canada 2010).
References:
Doughman S.D., Krupanidhi S., Sanjeevi C.B. 2007. Omega-3 Fatty Acids for Nutrition and Medicine: Considering Microalgae Oil as a Vegetarian Source of EPA and DHA. Current Diabetes Reviews 3: 198-203.

URL: http://www.itis.gov/ [Accessed 2010-05-14].";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:75:"Classified as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 1 (alga) of the NHP Regulations.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:103:"Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1 (algue) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:0:"";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"85452";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:19:"Schizochytrium spp.";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"AHN";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:4:"ALGA";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";s:5:"title";s:23:"Schizochytrium spp._AHN";s:3:"nid";s:6:"197533";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:197534;a:25:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:11:"95133;94423";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:1215:"Zanthoxylum zanthoxyloides is a plant from the family Rutaceae, native to Africa (USDA 2010). The methanolic extract and/or compounds isolated from the root bark of this plant, such as fagaronine and fagaramide, have shown acetylcholinesterase inhibitory, radical-scavenging, antifungal, and/or antibacterial activities (Queiroz et al. 2006).
Based on the above, Zanthoxylum zanthoxyloides meets the substance aspect of the natural health product definition, under Schedule 1, item 1 (plant) of the Natural Health Products Regulations (Government of Canada 2010).

According to the product associated website (www.evoraplus.com), in addition to 'Freshens breath' and 'withens teeth', 'supports gum and teeth health' is claimed as one of the recommended use or purpose. Therefore, this product also meets the function aspect of the NHP definition, as outlined in the NHPR.

Marine Biotechnology 11(5):585-595.";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:75:"Classified as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 1 (alga) of the NHP Regulations.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:103:"Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1 (algue) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:0:"";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"85459";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:24:"Nannochloropsis gaditana";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"AHN";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:4:"ALGA";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";s:5:"title";s:28:"Nannochloropsis gaditana_AHN";s:3:"nid";s:6:"197540";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:197541;a:25:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:11:"95711;94423";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:2538:"Salacia species are found mainly in India and Sri Lanka and has a long history of use as a treatment for diabetes in traditional Indian medicine, Ayurveda, Mugs made from salacia wood are used by people with diabetes to drink water [6]
Initial evidence concluded that consuming salacia tea with each meal might lower hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) levels in people with type 2 diabetes [1]. A single dose of salacia, in combination with a meal, also seems to decrease postprandial serum insulin levels and decrease postprandial blood glucose in healthy volunteers and in people with type 2 diabetes [2, 3, 4].
Roots and stems are the important source parts of this plant . Active constituents such as salacinol and kotalanol are found in the water-soluble portion of a methanol extract of salacia . These constituents seem to inhibit alpha-glucosidase in the intestinal brush border and intestinal aldose reductase, sucrase, maltase and isomaltase[4, 5]
Salacia reticulata will be classified as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 1 (plant or plant material) of the Natural Health Product Regulations. Salacinol and Kotalanol being active constituents found in roots and stems
1) Jayawardena MH, de Alwis NM, Hettigoda V, Fernando DJ. A double blind randomised placebo controlled cross over study of a herbal preparation containing Salacia reticulata in the treatment of type 2 diabetes. J Ethnopharmacol 2005;97:215-8
2) Heacock PM, Hertzler SR, Williams JA, Wolf BW. Effects of a medical food containing an herbal alpha-glucosidase inhibitor on postprandial glycemia and insulinemia in healthy adults. J Am Diet Assoc 2005;105:65-71.
3) Collene AL, Hertzler SR, Williams JA, Wolf BW. Effects of a nutritional supplement containing Salacia oblonga extract and insulinogenic amino acids on postprandial glycemia, insulinemia, and breath hydrogen responses in healthy adults. Nutrition 2005;21:848-54.
4)Williams JA, Choe YS, Noss MJ, et al. Extract of Salacia oblonga lowers acute glycemia in patients with type 2 diabetes. Am J Clin Nutr 2007;86:124-30.
5)Matsuda H, Murakami T, Yashiro K, et al. Antidiabetic principles of natural medicines. IV. Aldose reductase and qlpha-glucosidase inhibitors from the roots of Salacia oblonga Wall. (Celastraceae): structure of a new friedelane-type triterpene, kotalagenin 16-acetate. Chem Pharm Bull (Tokyo) 1999;47:1725-9.
6)Ratnasooriya WD, Jayakody JR, Premakumara GA. Adverse pregnancy outcome in rats following exposure to a Salacia reticulata (Celastraceae) root extract. Braz J Med Biol Res 2003;36:931-5.";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:94:"Classified as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 1 (plant or plant material) of the NHP Regulations.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:104:"Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1 (plante) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:0:"";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"85460";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:18:"Salacia reticulata";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"AHN";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:5:"PLANT";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";s:5:"title";s:22:"Salacia reticulata_AHN";s:3:"nid";s:6:"197541";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:197542;a:25:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:11:"95738;94423";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:838:"Sarcostemma brevistigma is a leafless, trailing shrub native to various parts of India. The aerial parts contain the pregene glycosides brevinine and brevine[Kumar 2006]. The plant extract has traditionally been used for treating the symptoms of asthma, and is reported to act as a spasmolytic by inhibiting smooth muscle contractions[Kumar 2007]. Sarcostemma brevistigma will be considered a NHP under Schedule 1, item 1, plant, of the Natural Health Products Regulations.

are freshwater and marine microalgae which dominate the phytoplankton communities and are considered to be the most important primary producers in sustaining the marine food chain [d’Ippolito et al. 2004]. Marine microalgae are a rich source of bioactive ingredients such as vitamins, minerals, fibre, antioxidants, pigments, fatty acids, sterols and polysaccharides. In many countries, food industries utilise a wide range of these algae, and controlled cultivation is currently being used to produce these organisms on a large scale [Ioannou and Roussis 2009]. The marine diatom Skeletonema costatum will be considered a NHP under Schedule 1, item 1, (alga) of the Natural Health Products Regulations.

naturels";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:0:"";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"85470";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:17:"Tamarindus indica";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"AHN";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:5:"PLANT";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";s:5:"title";s:21:"Tamarindus indica_AHN";s:3:"nid";s:6:"197551";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:197552;a:25:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:11:"95287;94423";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:1884:"Marine microalgae, which include diatoms, are a rich source of bioactive ingredients such as vitamins, minerals, fibre, antioxidants, pigments, fatty acids, sterols and polysaccharides. In many countries, food industries utilise a wide range of these algae, and controlled cultivation is currently being used to produce these organisms on a large scale [Ioannou and Roussis 2009]. The marine diatom Chaetoceros radicans will be considered a NHP under Schedule 1, item 1, (alga) of the Natural Health Products Regulations.

The marine diatom Thalassiosira rotula will be considered a NHP under Schedule 1, item 1, (alga) of the Natural Health Products Regulations.

They are spirotrich ciliates and are among the most abundant marine planktonic forms{McManus et al. 2010]. Marine microalgae are a rich source of bioactive ingredients such as vitamins, minerals, fibre, antioxidants, pigments, fatty acids, sterols and polysaccharides. In many countries, food industries utilise a wide range of these algae, and controlled cultivation is currently being used to produce these organisms on a large scale [Ioannou and Roussis 2009]. Strombidium spp will be considered a NHP under Schedule 1, item 1, (alga) of the Natural Health Products Regulations.

This botanical is used as an astringent to tonify tissues and reduce excessive menstrual flow, blood in the urine, and loss of fluid or blood in diarrhoea and colitis [Hoffmann 2003]. A major alkaloid of Vinca minor is Vincamine, which has been used therapeutically as a vasodilator and antihypertensive agent, particularly in cerebrovascular disorders [CHEMID; Vas & Gulyás 2005].
Vinca minor will be considered a NHP under Schedule 1, item 1, (plant) of the Natural Health Products Regulations.

Food uses include consumption of whole young plants raw and also cooked in stir fry dishes; bulbs of Allium macrostemon are eaten in salads and are pickled (Facciola 1998). In Traditional Chinese Medicine, the bulb of Allium macrostemon is used to treat painful obstruction of the chest, and associated shortness of breath and wheezing. It is also used to treat some types of diarrhea or dysentery (Bensky et al. 2004; Chen and Chen 2004).Allium macrostemon will be considered an NHP under Schedule 1, item 1, (plant) of the Natural Health Products Regulations.
References:
Bensky D, Clavey S, Stoger E. 2004. Chinese Herbal Medicine: Materia Medica, 3rd edition.: Seattle (WA): Eastland Press.
Chen JK, Chen TT. 2004. Chinese Medical Herbology and Pharmacology. City of Industry (CA, USA): Art of Medicine Press.
Facciola S. 1998. Cornucopia II, A Source Book of Edible Plants. Vista (CA, USA): Kampong Publications.

Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:736:"Not applicable to whole herb preparations: The quantity or concentration of carvacrol in all applicable essential oils or extracts must be declared. Based on safety concerns, thyme essential oil oral intake of up to 4.16 micrograms/kg body weight per day is allowed, and the daily oral exposure of carvacrol from the product must not exceed 0.23 micrograms/kg bw per day. If applicants would like to use a thyme essential oil or extract with a higher content of carvacrol as a non-medicinal ingredient (NMI) in their product, they must provide evidence to support its safe use. In the absence of adequate safety evidence, if the daily exposure of carvacrol exceeds the specified maximum, the ingredient cannot be considered to be a NMI.";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:948:"Non applicable au préparations à base de plantes complètes: La quantité ou concentration de carvacrol dans toutes les huiles ou extraits essentiels applicables doit être déclarée. Si les demandeurs veulent utiliser une huile essentielle ou extrait de thym qui contient une quantité élevée de carvacrol comme ingrédient non-médicinal dans leur produit, ils doivent fournir des preuves pour supporter son usage sécuritaire. Dans l'absence de preuves suffisantes appuyant l'innocuité, si l'exposition au carvacrol dépasse la valeur maximale spécifiée, l'ingrédient ne peut pas être considéré comme un ingrédient Not applicable to whole herb preparations: Based on safety concerns, oregano oil intake of up to 0.27 micrograms/kg body weight per day is allowed. Applicants must provide evidence to support the safe use of the carvacrol content of oil of oregano, if they would like to use a higher quantity as a NMI in their product. Les demandeurs doivent fournir des preuves appuyant l'innocuité de la quantité du carvacrol dans l'huile d'origan s'ils désirent en utiliser une quantité plus élevée comme ingrédient non médicinal dans leurs produits. microgrammes /kg de poids corporel par chinensis is a Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) medicinal ingredient made from the whole plant, which is used medicinally to smooth qi and relieve pain due to qi stagnation, remove dampness, and treat rheumatic arthralgia, heart pain and stomach pain due to qi stagnation, and treat Hong Kong feet [Jiang Su New Medical College. 1997].
Pothos chinensis will be considered a NHP under Schedule 1, item 2, (an isolate) of the Natural Health Products Regulations.

R0179_ABN";s:3:"nid";s:6:"198011";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-12-20";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:198012;a:25:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:5:"98168";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:1635:"Part II of Schedule F to the Regulations is amended by repealing (removing from Schedule F) the following: Centella asiatica extract and active principles thereof. Following the review of the naturally sourced medicinal ingredients on Schedule F, the Committee recommended the above naturally sourced medicinal ingredient be removed from Schedule F to the Food and Drug Regulations as none of the factors for listing in Schedule F were found to apply. Canada Gazette Part II: http://www.gazette.gc.ca/rp-pr/p2/2011/2011-12-07/pdf/g2-14525.pdf
December 13, 2005 discussions between TPD, NHPD, Inspectorate and Legal Services    While from a scientific perspective, a product containing gotukola crude herb or part(s) of the herb consists of "Centella asiatica extract and active principles thereof", it was agreed that the listing was intended to include extract products specifically. It was agreed that products containing the crude herb or part(s) thereof were not captured by the current Schedule F text.  NHPD and TPD will continue discussions regarding this listing and others on Schedule F of substances that may otherwise be considered natural health products. The Inspectorate will proceed with compliance and enforcement actions guided by this interpretation, i.e., any product other than those containing the crude herb or part(s) thereof will be considered to be captured by the Schedule F listing "Centella asiatica extract and active principles thereof". The decision recorded is that the current Schedule F listing includes extracts only and should be read to exclude products consisting the crude herb or parts maldivica_AHN";s:3:"nid";s:6:"198092";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2014-06-26";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:198093;a:25:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:25:"92722;93318;103663;112478";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:3677:"Classified as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 1 (plant or plant material) of the NHP Regulations. Piper methysticum has been identified as a substance with potential health risks. Therefore, as per the Natural Health Product Compliance Guide, unauthorized products for sale in Canada which contain this ingredient are subject to compliance action in conjunction with the Risk-Based Approach. While NHPD will accept product licence applications for products containing Piper methysticum, sufficient evidence for the safety, efficacy and quality of the product must be provided before an NPN will be granted.     http://www.hc-sc.gc.ca/dhp-mps/prodnatur/legislation/docs/complian-conform_guide_e.html
Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1 (plante ou matière végétale) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels. Piper methysticum a été identifié comme substance avec des risques possibles pour la santé.  Par conséquent, tel qu'indiqué dans le Guide de conformité des produits de santé naturels, des produits non homologués en vente au Canada qui contiennent cet ingrédient font l'object de mesures de conformité en conjonction avec l'approche fondée sur les risques.  Même si la DPSN accepte des demandes de produits de santé naturels contenant Piper methysticum, des preuves à l'appui suffisante en terme d'innocuité, d'efficacité et de qualité du produit doivent être fournies avant qu'un NPN soit accordé. http://www.hc-sc.gc.ca/dhp-mps/prodnatur/legislation/docs/complian-conform_guide_f.html
The amount of kavalactones in Piper methysticum should be provided for the Safety and Efficacy assessment of Product Licence Applications.
The presence of this ingredient without conditions on the List of Prohibited and Restricted Cosmetic Ingredients (the Cosmetic Ingredient Hotlist) indicates that there are potentially significant safety issues. This ingredient cannot be used in topical natural health products without the submission of additional evidence for safety. Reference: http://www.hc-sc.gc.ca/cps-spc/person/cosmet/info-ind-prof/_hot-list-critique/prohibited-eng.php. This ingredient  is on the Restricted Substances list in the Natural Health Products Compliance Guide. 
Unauthorized products with this ingredient are subject to the risk-based approach to compliance. A product licence must be obtained prior to marketing in Canada . Reference:http://www.hc-sc.gc.ca/dhp-mps/prodnatur/legislation/docs/complian-conform_guide-eng.php
Le montant de kavalactones dans Piper methysticum devrait être fourni pour l'évaluation d'innocuité et d'efficacité des demandes de licence de mise en marché
La présence de cet ingrédient sur la Liste critique des ingrédients dont l'utilisation est restreinte ou interdite dans les cosmétiques indique qu'il existe potentiellement des problèmes d'innocuité. Cet ingrédient ne peut être utilisé dans des PSN topiques sauf selon les restrictions trouvées dans la liste critique à moins de fournir des preuves additionnelles à l'appui de son innocuité. Référence: http://www.hc-sc.gc.ca/cps-spc/cosmet-person/index-fra.php.  Cet ingrédient apparaît sur la liste des substances prohibées du Guide de conformité concernant les produits de santé naturels.   Les produits contenant cet ingrédient qui n'ont pas d'autorisation de mise en marché sont sujets à une approche de conformité qui est prise conjointement avec une approche basée sur les risques.  Une licence de mise en marché doit être obtenue avec de pouvoir poursuivre la commercialisation du produit.  Référence:  http://www.hc-sc.gc.ca/dhp-mps/prodnatur/legislation/docs/complian-conform_guide-fra.php";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:114:"Classified as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 1 (plant or plant material) of the Natural Health Products Regulations.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:128:"Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1 (plante ou matière végétale) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels.";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:1012:"Piper methysticum has been identified as an ingredient with potential health risks, consistent with its presence without conditions on the List of Prohibited and Restricted Cosmetic Ingredients (the Cosmetic Ingredient Hotlist).  Therefore, unauthorized products for sale in Canada which contain this ingredient are subject to compliance in conjunction with the Risk-Based Approach.  NHPD accepts Product Licence Applications (PLAs) for products containing Piper methysticum provided that sufficient evidence for the safety, efficacy, and quality of the product is provided.  The amount of kavalactones in Piper methysticum should be indicated on PLA forms, and human clinical data must be provided for safety assessment, unless: 1) the amount of kavalactones does not exceed 125 mg per dosage unit; and 2) the preparation does not contain, for its recommended daily dose, more than 250 mg of kavalactones; and 3) the product contains whole or peeled rhizome or an aqueous extract of the whole or peeled rhizome.";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:1238:"Piper methysticum a été identifié comme un ingrédient associé à des risques potentiels pour la santé, conformément à sa présence sans conditions sur la Liste critique des ingrédients dont l'utilisation est restreinte ou interdite dans les cosmétiques (Liste critique des ingrédients de cosmétiques).  Par conséquent, les produits non homologués en vente au Canada qui contiennent cet ingrédient font l'objet de mesures de conformité en conjunction avec l'approche fondée sur les risques.  La DPSN accepte les Demandes de licence de mise en marché (DLMM) pour les produits contenant Piper methysticum à condition que des preuves suffisantes pour l'innocuité, l'efficacité et la qualité du produit soit fournies.  La teneur en kavalactones dans Piper methysticum devrait être indiqué sur les formulaires de DLMM, et des données cliniques humaines doivent être fournies pour l'évaluation de l'innocuité, à moins que: 1) la quantité de kavalactones ne dépasse pas 125 mg par unité posologique; et 2) la préparation ne contient pas, pour sa dose quotidienne recommandée, plus de 250 mg de kavalactones; et 3) le produit contient le rhizome entier ou pelé ou un extrait aqueux de rhizomes entiers ou subtilis is a Gram-positive, catalase-positive bacterium commonly found in soil. A member of the genus Bacillus, Bacillus subtilis, has the ability to form a tough, protective endospore, allowing the organism to tolerate extreme environmental conditions. Bacillus subtilis is currently being used for oral bacteriotherapy and bacterioprophylaxis of gastrointestinal disorders (mostly as a direct result of antibiotic treatment), many of which lead to diarrhea. as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 1 (non-human animal material) of the NHP Regulations. As per the Quality of Natural Health Products Guide, animal substances responsible for producing or possibly containing one or more hormones that fall under the Prescription Drug List and/or Schedule D to the Food and Drugs Act and/or Schedule IV of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act, are only acceptable for inclusion as an ingredient in natural health products when they do not contain hormones indicated in these schedules. Evidence or data that confirm that the animal substances found in the product are free from the prohibited hormones must be provided for natural health products submissions. A copy of a certificate of analysis or any other equivalent document confirming the absence of the prohibited hormones in the finished product would be acceptable.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:1083:"Consideré comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1 (matière animale autre qu'une matière provenant de l'humain) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels. Selon le Guide de référence sur la qualité des produits de santé naturels, les substances animales responsables de la production ou pouvant contenir une ou plusieurs hormones qui relèvent de la Liste des drogues sur ordonnance et/ou de l'Annexe D de la Loi sur les aliments et drogues et/ou de l'Annexe IV de la Loi règlementant certaines drogues et autres substances sont seulement acceptables comme ingrédients dans les produits de santé naturels lorsqu'elles sont exemptent des hormones indiquées dans ces annexes.  Des preuves ou des données qui vont confirmer que les substances animales trouvées dans le produit sont exemptent des hormones prohibées doivent être fournies avec les demandes de licence de mise en marché de produit de santé naturel.  Une copie du certificat d'analyse ou un autre document équivalent qui confirme l'absence des hormones prohibées dans le produit fini serait acceptable.";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:0:"";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"85806";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:10:"Ovis aries";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"ABN";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:6:"NHANML";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";s:5:"title";s:14:"Ovis aries_ABN";s:3:"nid";s:6:"198136";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2014-10-14";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:198137;a:25:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:24:"99462;98808;94423;114728";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:1678:"As per the NHPD Monthly Communiqué Volume 2, Issue 5 - February 2007, animal substances responsible for producing or possibly containing one or more of certain sex hormones that fall under the Prescription Drug List and/or Schedule IV of the Controlled Drug and Substances Act, are only acceptable for inclusion as an ingredient in natural health products when they are free from sex hormones indicated in these schedules. Evidence or data that confirm that the animal substances found in the product are free from the prohibited sex hormones must be provided for natural health products submissions. A copy of a certificate of analysis or any other equivalent document confirming the absence of the prohibited sex hormones in the finished product would be acceptable.
Comme indiqué dans le Communiqué mensuel de la DPSN Volume 2, numéro 5 - Février 2007, les substances animales responsables pour la production ou qui possiblement contiennent une ou plusieurs hormones sexuelles qui tombent sous le coup de la Liste des drogues sur ordonnance et/ou l'Annexe IV de la Loi règlementant certaines drogues et autres substances, sont seulement acceptables comme ingrédients dans des produits de santé naturels lorsqu'elles sont exemptes d'hormones sexuelles provenant de ces annexes. Des preuves ou des données qui vont confirmer que les substances animales trouvées dans le produit sont exemptes des hormones sexuelles prohibées doivent être fournies avec les présentations de produit de santé naturel. as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 1 (fungus) of the Natural Health Products Regulations.  Penicillium spp. or its preparations, other than homeopathic preparations, are only acceptable for inclusion in a natural health product when they do not contain Penicillin or its salts or derivatives, as these substances are listed on the Prescription Drug List.  Evidence or data that confirm that Penicillium spp. or its preparations are free from, or manufactured in order to be free from, Penicillin or its salts or derivatives must be provided with product licence applications.  A copy of a certificate of analysis, manufacturing process, or any other document confirming the absence of Penicillin or its salts or derivatives in the ingredient or finished product would be acceptable.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:886:"Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1 (champignon) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels.  Les espèces de Penicillium ou ses préparations, autres que les préparations homéopatiques, sont seulement acceptables dans un produit de santé naturel lorsqu'elles sont exemptes de Pénicilline ou ses sels ou dérivés, puisque ces substances sont inscrites sur la Liste des drogues sur ordonnance.  Des preuves ou des données qui confirment que les espèces de Penicillium ou ses préparations sont exemptes de, ou fabriquées pour être exemptes de, Pénicilline ou ses sels ou dérivés doivent être fournis avec les demandes de licence de mise en marché. Les espèces de Penicillium ou ses préparations, autres que les préparations homéopatiques, sont seulement acceptables dans un produit de santé naturel lorsqu'elles sont exemptes de Pénicilline ou ses sels ou dérivés, puisque ces substances sont inscrites sur la Liste des drogues sur ordonnance.  Des preuves ou des données qui confirment que les espèces de Penicillium ou ses préparations sont exemptes de, ou fabriquées pour être exemptes de, Pénicilline ou ses sels ou dérivés doivent être fournis avec les demandes de licence de mise en marché.  Une copie d'un certificat d'analyse, du processus de fabrication, ou tout autre document confirmant l'absence de Pénicilline ou ses sels ou dérivés dans l'ingrédient ou le produit fini serait acceptable.";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:0:"";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"85072";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:22:"Penicillium multicolor";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"AHN";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:4:"FUNG";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";s:5:"title";s:26:"Penicillium multicolor_AHN";s:3:"nid";s:6:"198145";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2014-10-23";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:198146;a:25:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:13:"114785;114917";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:0:"";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:790:"Classified as an NHP under Schedule 1 item 1 (fungus) of the Natural Health Products Regulations.  Penicillium spp. or its preparations, other than homeopathic preparations, are only acceptable for inclusion in a natural health product when they do not contain Penicillin or its salts or derivatives, as these substances are listed on the Prescription Drug List.  Evidence or data that confirm that Penicillium spp. or its preparations are free from, or manufactured in order to be free from, Penicillin or its salts or derivatives must be provided with product licence applications.  A copy of a certificate of analysis, manufacturing process, or any other document confirming the absence of Penicillin or its salts or derivatives in the ingredient or finished product would be acceptable.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:886:"Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1 (champignon) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels. subspinipes mutilans_ABN";s:3:"nid";s:6:"198209";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2015-02-12";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:198210;a:25:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:13:"101846;115654";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:1797:"2006-09-17  02:44 PM    Hemp is a common name for cannabis, a genus of flowering plant famously known for its part being use in the production of the drug marijuana.  However, the name hemp is more commonly used when this annual plant is grown for non-drug purposes.  In fact, many parts of this plant are used for other purposes, such as to make cordage of greatly varying tensility, clothing, food, and the oils from the seeds can be made into paint or used for cooking. Cannabis and its derivatives are currently listed on Schedule II of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act.  However, non-viable cannabis seed (hemp seed) are excluded from this listing, therefore non-viable Hemp seed will be considered as a NHP, under Schedule 1, item 1 (Priority 4; Plant material) of the NHP Regulations.    Schedule II listing is as follows:     1. Cannabis, its preparations, derivatives and similar synthetic preparations, including:  (1) Cannabis resin  (2) Cannabis (marihuana)  (3)Cannabidiol (2--[3--methyl--6--(1--methylethenyl)--2--cyclohexen--  1--yl]--5--pentyl--1,3--benzenediol)  (4) Cannabinol (3--n--amyl--6,6,9--trimethyl--6--dibenzopyran --1--ol)  (5) Nabilone ((±)--trans--3--(1,1--dimethylheptyl)--6,6a, 7,8,10,10a--hexahydro--1--hydroxy--6,6--dimethyl --9H--dibenzo[b,d]pyran--9--one)  (6) Pyrahexyl (3--n--hexyl--6,6,9--trimethyl--7,8,9, 10--tetrahydro--6--dibenzopyran--1--ol)  (7) Tetrahydrocannabinol (tetrahydro--6,6,9--trimethyl--3 --pentyl--6H--dibenzo[b,d]pyran--1--ol)  (7.1) 3-(1,2-dimethylheptyl)-7,8,9,10-tetrahydro-6,6,9-trimethyl-6H-dibenzo[b,d]pryan-1-ol(DMHP)  but not including  (8) Non-viable Cannabis seed, with the exception of its derivatives  (9) Mature Cannabis stalks that do not include leaves, flowers, seeds or branches; and fiber derived from such stalks";s:29:"field_quantity_restriction_on";s:0:"";s:17:"field_rationale_e";s:581:"Cannabis sativa, in part, includes hemp: non-viable hemp seeds, mature stalks that do not include leaves, flowers, seeds or branches, and fibre derived from such stalks. These are plant materials that fall under Item 1 of Schedule 1 to the Natural Health Products Regulations. Hemp seed derivatives such as hemp seed oil and protein fall under Item 2 of Schedule 1 to the Natural Health Products Regulations, as extracts or isolates of a substance described in item 1, the primary molecular structure of which is identical to that which it had prior to its extraction or isolation.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:717:"Le Cannabis sativa, en partie, comprend du chanvre indien: graines de cannabis stérile, tige de cannabis mature - à l'exception des branches, des feuilles, des fleurs et des graines - ainsi que les fibres obtenues de cette tige. Il s'agit de matières végétales qui sont couvertes par l'article 1 de l'annexe 1 du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels. Les dérivés de graines de cannabis comme l'huile et les protéines sont couverts par l'article 2 de l'annexe 1 du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels, comme extraits ou isolats d'une substance décrite à l'article 1, dont la structure moléculaire principale est identique à celle qu'ils avaient avant leur extraction ou leur isolement.";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:327:"Hemp products cannot contain more than 10 ppm of delta-9-tetrahydro-cannabinol (THC), and their production must be in compliance with the Industrial Hemp Regulations.

naturels.";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_e";s:0:"";s:24:"field_restriction_desc_f";s:0:"";s:17:"field_upper_limit";s:0:"";s:10:"field_date";s:10:"2015-02-12";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:6:"108744";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:19:"Pleione yunnanensis";s:20:"field_ingredient_cat";s:3:"AHN";s:25:"field_nhpd_classification";s:5:"PLANT";s:10:"field_unit";s:0:"";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:0:"";s:9:"field_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:15:"field_other_ref";s:0:"";s:5:"title";s:23:"Pleione yunnanensis_AHN";s:3:"nid";s:6:"198213";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2015-02-12";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:198214;a:25:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"MI";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:12:"95013;115654";s:17:"field_lower_limit";s:0:"";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:3714:"Proper Name(s): Menispermum dauricum (Tropicos 2010, USDA 2010)
Common Name(s): Bian fu ge (Tropicos 2010)
Menispermum dauricum is a plant from the family Menispermaceae, used in traditional Chinese medicine, that has shown to possess various biological activities (Tropicos 2010, USDA 2010, Wang et al. 2001, Yu et al. 2001). Several compounds have been isolated from the roots and/or rhizomes of this plant, of particular interest the chlorinated alkaloids acutumine, acutumidine, dauricumine, and dauricumidine, as well as their dechlorinated derivatives dechloroacutumine and dechlorodauricumine (O’Neil et al. 2010, Hori et al. 2009, Sugimoto et al. 2007, Zhou et al. 2007, Sugimoto et al. 2005, Zhang et al. 2004, Yasuda et al. 2003, Yu et al. 2002, Furumoto and Sugimoto 2001, Sugimoto et al. 2001)

Based on the above, Menispermum dauricum meets the substance aspect of the Natural Health Product (NHP) definition, under Schedule 1, item 1 (plant) of the NHP Regulations (Government of Canada 2010).

References:

Furumoto T., Sugimoto Y. 2001. Acutudaurin from Cultured Roots of Menispermum dauricum. Planta Med. 67: 194-195.

Government of Canada 2010. Natural Health Products Regulations. URL: http://laws.justice.gc.ca/en/showtdm/cr/SOR-2003-196//?showtoc=&instrumentnumber=SOR-2003-196 [Accessed 2010-04-27].

O’Neil M.J., Heckelman P.E., Koch C.B., Roman K.J. (Eds). 2010. The Merck Index: an encyclopedia of chemicals, drugs, and Biologicals, Fourteenth Edition (2006). Merck & Co. Inc., Whitehouse Station, NJ, USA. Electronic version [Accessed 2010-04-26].

Sugimoto Y., Babiker H.A.A., Saisho T., Furumoto T., Inanaga S., Kato M. 2001. Chlorinated Alkaloids in Menispermum dauricum DC. Root Culture. J. Org. Chem. 66: 3299-3302.

Sugimoto Y., Matsui M., Takikawa H., Sasaki M., Kato M. 2005. Dechlorodauricumine from cultured roots of Menispermum dauricum. Phytochemistry 66: 2627-2631.

Sugimoto Y., Matsui M. Babiker H.A.A. 2007. Conversion of dechlorodauricumine into chlorinated alkaloids in Menispermum dauricum root culture. Phytochemistry 68: 493-498.

Zhang X., Ye W., Zhao S., Che C.-T. 2004. Isoquinoline and isoindole alkaloids from Menispermum dauricum. Phytochemistry 65: 929-932.

Zhou J., Qu F., Nan R. 2007. Genetic and Alkaloid Analysis of Menispermum dauricum DC. by RAPD and HPLC. Asarum sieboldii has been identified as a substance with potential health risks. Therefore, as per the Natural Health Product Compliance Guide, unauthorized products for sale in Canada which contain this ingredient are subject to compliance action in conjunction with the Risk-Based Approach. While NHPD will accept product licence applications for products containing Asarum canadense, sufficient evidence for the safety, efficacy and quality of the product must be provided before an NPN will be granted.http://www.hc-sc.gc.ca/dhp-mps/prodnatur/legislation/docs/complian-conform_guide_e.html.";s:17:"field_rationale_f";s:830:"Classifié comme PSN sous Annexe 1, article 1 (plante ou matière végétale) du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels. Asarum sieboldii a été identifié comme substance avec des risques possibles pour la santé. Par conséquent, tel qu'indiqué dans le Guide de conformité des produits de santé naturels, des produits non homologués en vente au Canada qui contiennent cet ingrédient font l'object de mesures de conformité en conjonction avec l'approche fondée sur les risques.
